attributes.action: increase fines for cycling on the pavement to a realistic level; e.g £500.  Also punish death caused by pavement cycling as severely as that caused by dangerous driving.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I understand that the current penalty is a fine of £60 (or maybe even £30).  How can this possibly be considered a deterrent?  Many people would probably not even miss it.

Looking through existing petitions on this issue, including those which have closed or were rejected, I saw many making very forceful arguments against pavement cycling.  One of these referred to an appalling incident in which a cyclist killed a couple of people by, as far as I remember, cycling at them; at any rate I do remember that he (or she but think it was a man) shouted that he (or she) wasn't going to get out of the way.  More recently I read in a London free paper about an incident in which someone was killed by a cyclist "riding like a madman" who jumped on to the pavement in order to avoid a red light; this person was gaoled for all of 10 months.  It's well past time for penalties for pavement cycling to be realistic.
